name: determinacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being fixed or exact, or the ability to be determined (= known or discovered): This is an illustration of the variable determinacy of genetic factors. Typically, solving a problem involves moving from indeterminacy to greater determinacy.
More examplesFewer examplesHe questioned the determinacy of the legal statutes. It is often assumed that the determinacy of a causal relationship increases as that relationship becomes narrower and more specific.Such a law, they suggest, will always lack determinacy and democratic legitimacy.
